meanings.definition: To subject (wood or other material) to fire or intense heat in order to dry or carbonize it.
meanings.sent1: The workers will torrefy the wood to make it suitable for building.
meanings.sent2: The chef will torrefy the coffee beans to enhance their flavor.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally torrefied my marshmallow over the campfire, making it extra crispy.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays torrefy the desert sand, turning it into a scorching surface.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith used the forge to torrefy the metal, shaping it into a strong blade.

meanings.definition: To roast or parch (a substance) in order to remove moisture or impurities.
meanings.sent1: She will torrefy the nuts before adding them to the salad.
meanings.sent2: The baker will torrefy the grains to give the bread a nutty flavor.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn machine accidentally torrefied the kernels, resulting in a burnt smell.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the summer sun can torrefy the grass, turning it yellow.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a torch to torrefy the edges of the paper, creating a unique effect.
